intro: Senkenbergia gypsophiloides, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a flowering plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are linear and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. Senkenbergia gypsophiloides is often found in limestone or gypsum soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny habitats.
